      Checks for present certificate serial number unique index in a new transaction in order to avoid rollback, since we can expect SQL exceptions here.

      • storeCertificate

        public CertificateDataWrapper storeCertificate​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                               Certificate incert,
                                               String username,
                                               String cafp,
                                               int status,
                                               int type,
                                               int certificateProfileId,
                                               int endEntityProfileId,
                                               String tag,
                                               long updateTime)
                                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Stores a certificate.
        Specified by:
        storeCertificate in interface CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - An authentication token to authorize the action
        incert - The certificate to be stored.
        username - username of end entity owning the certificate.
        cafp - Fingerprint (hex) of the CAs certificate.
        status - the status from the CertificateConstants.CERT_ constants
        type - Type of certificate (CERTTYPE_ENDENTITY etc from CertificateConstants).
        certificateProfileId - the certificate profile id this cert was issued under
        endEntityProfileId - the end entity profile id this cert was issued under
        tag - a custom string tagging this certificate for some purpose
        updateTime - epoch millis to use as last update time of the stored object
        Returns:
        CertificateDataWrapper with the certificate just stored that can be used for further publishing
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin was not authorized to store certificate in database

      • storeCertificateRemote

        public void storeCertificateRemote​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                   CertificateWrapper wrappedCert,
                                   String username,
                                   String cafp,
                                   int status,
                                   int type,
                                   int certificateProfileId,
                                   int endEntityProfileId,
                                   String tag,
                                   long updateTime)
                            throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSessionRemote
        Stores a certificate (remote EJB interface).
        Specified by:
        storeCertificateRemote in interface CertificateStoreSessionRemote
        Parameters:
        admin - An authentication token to authorize the action
        wrappedCert - Wrapper of the certificate to be stored. Use EJBTools.wrap(java.security.cert.Certificate) to construct to the wrapper.
        username - username of end entity owning the certificate.
        cafp - Fingerprint (hex) of the CAs certificate.
        status - the status from the CertificateConstants.CERT_ constants
        type - Type of certificate (CERTTYPE_ENDENTITY etc from CertificateConstants).
        certificateProfileId - the certificate profile id this cert was issued under
        endEntityProfileId - the end entity profile id the cert was issued under
        tag - a custom string tagging this certificate for some purpose
        updateTime - epoch millis to use as last update time of the stored object
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin was not authorized to store certificate in database

      • listAllCertificates

        public Collection<String> listAllCertificates​(String issuerdn)
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSession
        Lists fingerprint (primary key) of ALL certificates in the database. NOTE: Caution should be taken with this method as execution may be very heavy indeed if many certificates exist in the database (imagine what happens if there are millions of certificates in the DB!). Should only be used for testing purposes.
        Specified by:
        listAllCertificates in interface CertificateStoreSession
        Parameters:
        issuerdn - the dn of the certificates issuer.
        Returns:
        Collection of fingerprints, i.e. Strings

      • listRevokedCertInfo

        public Collection<RevokedCertInfo> listRevokedCertInfo​(String issuerdn,
                                                       long lastbasecrldate)
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSession
        Lists RevokedCertInfo of ALL revoked certificates (status = CertificateConstants.CERT_REVOKED) in the database from a certain issuer. NOTE: Caution should be taken with this method as execution may be very heavy indeed if many certificates exist in the database (imagine what happens if there are millions of certificates in the DB!). Should only be used for testing purposes.
        Specified by:
        listRevokedCertInfo in interface CertificateStoreSession
        Parameters:
        issuerdn - the dn of the certificates issuer.
        lastbasecrldate - a date (Date.getTime()) of last base CRL or -1 for a complete CRL
        Returns:
        Collection of RevokedCertInfo, reverse ordered by expireDate where last expireDate is first in array.

        Parameters:
        subjectDN - the DN of the subject whose certificates will be retrieved.
        issuerDN - the DN of the certificates issuer.
        onlyActive - set to true to limit the search to active (non revoked, unexpired) certificates.

        public X509Certificate findLatestX509CertificateBySubject​(String subjectDN)
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSession
        Find the latest published X509Certificate matching the given subject DN. Note that this method does not check if the returned certificate was issued by a rollover CA.
        Specified by:
        findLatestX509CertificateBySubject in interface CertificateStoreSession
        Parameters:
        subjectDN - The subject DN to match.
        Returns:
        the sought result, or null if none exists.

      • findLatestX509CertificateBySubject

        public X509Certificate findLatestX509CertificateBySubject​(String subjectDN,
                                                          X509Certificate rolloverCA,
                                                          boolean findRollover)
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSession
        Find the latest published X509Certificate matching the given subject DN. This method can search for normal or rollover certificates.
        Specified by:
        findLatestX509CertificateBySubject in interface CertificateStoreSession
        Parameters:
        subjectDN - The subject DN to match.
        rolloverCA - The rollover certificate of the issuing CA, or null to not check if issued by a rollover certificate.
        findRollover - Whether a rollover or normal certificate should be returned.
        Returns:
        the sought result, or null if none exists.

      • findCertificatesByExpireTimeAndIssuerWithLimit

        public List<Certificate> findCertificatesByExpireTimeAndIssuerWithLimit​(Date expireTime,
                                                                        String issuerDN,
                                                                        int maxNumberOfResults)
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSession
        Finds certificates expiring within a specified time, issued by a specified issuer and have status "active" or "notifiedaboutexpiration".
        Specified by:
        findCertificatesByExpireTimeAndIssuerWithLimit in interface CertificateStoreSession
        Parameters:
        expireTime - The time by which the certificates will be expired
        issuerDN - The SubjectDN of the CA that issued the certificates that will expire within the given time
        maxNumberOfResults - The maximum number of certificates to be returned
        Returns:
        List of certificates (java.security.cert.Certificate), never null
        See Also:
        CertificateConstants.CERT_ACTIVE, CertificateConstants.CERT_NOTIFIEDABOUTEXPIRATION

                        throws CertificateRevokeException,
                               AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Set the status of certificate with given serno to revoked, or unrevoked (re-activation).
        Specified by:
        setRevokeStatus in interface CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken performing the operation
        cdw - the certificate data to revoke or activate.
        revokedDate - when it was revoked
        reason - the reason of the revocation. (One of the RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON constants.)

      • checkForUniqueCertificateSerialNumberIndexInTransaction

        public void checkForUniqueCertificateSerialNumberIndexInTransaction​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                                    Certificate incert,
                                                                    String username,
                                                                    String cafp,
                                                                    int status,
                                                                    int type,
                                                                    int certificateProfileId,
                                                                    int endEntityProfileId,
                                                                    String tag,
                                                                    long updateTime)
                                                             throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Checks for present certificate serial number unique index in a new transaction in order to avoid rollback, since we can expect SQL exceptions here. Should not be used externally. NOTE: does not add an event to the security audit log, that test certificates were added to the database, and removed. All normal operations that stores certificates in the database creates audit log events.
        Specified by:
        checkForUniqueCertificateSerialNumberIndexInTransaction in interface CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - An authentication token to authorize the action
        incert - The certificate to be stored.
        username - username of end entity owning the certificate.
        cafp - Fingerprint (hex) of the CAs certificate.
        status - the status from the CertificateConstants.CERT_ constants
        type - Type of certificate (CERTTYPE_ENDENTITY etc from CertificateConstants).
        certificateProfileId - the certificate profile id this cert was issued under
        endEntityProfileId - the end entity profile id this cert was issued under
        tag - a custom string tagging this certificate for some purpose
        updateTime - epoch millis to use as last update time of the stored object
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • updateLimitedCertificateDataStatus

        public void updateLimitedCertificateDataStatus​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                               int caId,
                                               String issuerDn,
                                               String subjectDn,
                                               String username,
                                               BigInteger serialNumber,
                                               int status,
                                               Date revocationDate,
                                               int reasonCode,
                                               String caFingerprint)
                                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Method for populating the CertificateData table with limited information for example from a CRL, so the OCSP responder can answer if a certificate is revoked. Existing entries may only be modified if they were created through this method. Updating an entry by providing RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON_REMOVEFROMCRL as reasonCode will remove the row from the table.
        Specified by:
        updateLimitedCertificateDataStatus in interface CertificateStoreSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - an admin that is authorized to the CA that issued the certificate
        caId - the CA identifier
        issuerDn - the BC normalized version of the issuer DN
        subjectDn - the BC normalized version of the subject DN
        username - Username
        serialNumber - the certificate serial number
        status - Certificate status
        revocationDate - the date of revocation
        reasonCode - one of RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON_...
        caFingerprint - the SHA-1 of the CA Certificate that issued this entry
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
